definition: morin khuur (Mongolian bowed stringed instrument)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: In his dining room, a self-made horse head string instrument caught my attention.
sentences.chinese: 饭厅里，一把自制的马头琴引起了我的注意。

sentences.english: Is there a solo of that fiddle?
sentences.chinese: 今天有没有马头琴独奏？

sentences.english: Seated on the ground are a group of young men playing horse-headed fiddles.
sentences.chinese: 坐在地上的是一些拉马头琴的年轻人。

sentences.english: That's the horse-head fiddle of the Mongolian nationality. Its music is rather moving.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族的马头琴，用它演奏的音乐非常感人。

definition: Dombra or Tambura, Kazakh plucked lute
sihu (or "khuurchir" in Mongolian), a bowed instrument with four strings, primarily associated with Mongolian and Chinese culture
Jew's harp
erhu (Chinese 2-string fiddle)/alto fiddle/CL:把[ba3]
plucked string music
muqam, Uyghur melody types that are the basis for a set of suites
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
musical instrument/CL:件[jian4]
bawu, a free reed wind instrument shaped like a flute and played transversally, associated particularly with minority cultures of Yunnan
accordion
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
shepherd's song/pastoral
wagon (yoked to beast of burden)
sax/saxophone
fiddle/violin
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
